20101230001048.000|20101230001050.000|TR0|I know the Obama administration hates this 
20101230001050.000|20101230001052.000|TR0|comparison, but this is just like 1995 all 
20101230001052.000|20101230001055.000|TR0|over again when the Republicans controlled 
20101230001055.000|20101230001057.000|TR0|the House and obviously Democrats 
20101230001057.000|20101230001059.000|TR0|controlled the Senate or the White House.
20101230001059.000|20101230001102.000|TR0|
20101230001102.000|20101230001104.000|TR0|What Clinton did and did it so well is he 
20101230001104.000|20101230001106.000|TR0|picked his fights.  He cherry picked 
20101230001106.000|20101230001109.000|TR0|certain issues popular with the American 
20101230001109.000|20101230001111.000|TR0|people and obviously he pushed back with 
20101230001111.000|20101230001113.000|TR0|Republicans.  What we saw in 1995, the 
20101230001113.000|20101230001116.000|TR0|president vetoed welfare reform twice and 
20101230001116.000|20101230001118.000|TR0|obviously he signed it into law.
20101230001118.000|20101230001120.000|TR0|
20101230001120.000|20101230001123.000|TR0|He pushed back on school uniforms and then 
20101230001123.000|20101230001125.000|TR0|he signed it into law. So what the 
20101230001125.000|20101230001127.000|TR0|president has to do is pick his fights and 
20101230001127.000|20101230001130.000|TR0|learn exactly when to triangulate.  I know 
20101230001130.000|20101230001132.000|TR0|we hate that word too and push back when 
20101230001132.000|20101230001134.000|TR0|need be.

20101230004228.000|20101230004231.000|TR0|
20101230004231.000|20101230004233.000|TR0|So, as you know, the passengers' bill of 
20101230004233.000|20101230004235.000|TR0|rights was supposed to prevent people 
20101230004235.000|20101230004238.000|TR0|getting stuck on the tarmac on loaded 
20101230004238.000|20101230004240.000|TR0|planes.  And you didn't see a lot of that 
20101230004240.000|20101230004242.000|TR0|with domestic flights this time around.  
20101230004242.000|20101230004245.000|TR0|But some people argue this passenger bill 
20101230004245.000|20101230004247.000|TR0|of rights did have a negative impact on 
20101230004247.000|20101230004249.000|TR0|some travelers that was unintended, 
20101230004249.000|20101230004252.000|TR0|because of big fines. Right now, if an 
20101230004252.000|20101230004254.000|TR0|airline does leave passengers in a plane, 
20101230004254.000|20101230004256.000|TR0|on the tarmac, for more than three hours, 
20101230004256.000|20101230004259.000|TR0|they face a very hefty fine, $27,500 for 
20101230004259.000|20101230004301.000|TR0|passenger, per incident.  Add that up on a 
20101230004301.000|20101230004303.000|TR0|crowded plane and you get a pretty big 
20101230004303.000|20101230004306.000|TR0|number.
20101230004306.000|20101230004308.000|TR0|
20101230004308.000|20101230004310.000|TR0|So some experts tell me today that they 
20101230004310.000|20101230004313.000|TR0|believe the airlines made some 
20101230004313.000|20101230004315.000|TR0|cancellations because they didn't want to 
20101230004315.000|20101230004317.000|TR0|risk getting those fines because of the 
20101230004317.000|20101230004320.000|TR0|weather.  When they weighed their options, 
20101230004320.000|20101230004322.000|TR0|these experts say, cancellations looked 
20101230004322.000|20101230004324.000|TR0|like a safer and much cheaper bet.
20101230004324.000|20101230004327.000|TR0|
20101230004327.000|20101230004329.000|TR0|Now people in the aviation industry are 
20101230004329.000|20101230004331.000|TR0|not fans of the passenger bill of rights,

20101230004336.000|20101230004338.000|TR0|cancellations were made because the

20101230004406.000|20101230004408.000|TR0|on the tarmac for much longer.  Are they 
20101230004408.000|20101230004411.000|TR0|not covered by the passenger bill of

20101230004413.000|20101230004415.000|TR0|
20101230004415.000|20101230004418.000|TR0|MESERVE:  Well, this isn't an easy answer. 
20101230004418.000|20101230004420.000|TR0| If you're a domestic carrier and you have 
20101230004420.000|20101230004422.000|TR0|an international flight in your rules and 
20101230004422.000|20101230004425.000|TR0|regulations, you are supposed to have 
20101230004425.000|20101230004427.000|TR0|specified how long you will leave loaded 
20101230004427.000|20101230004429.000|TR0|plane on the tarmac.  And if you violate 
20101230004429.000|20101230004432.000|TR0|that, you could be subject to fines.  But 
20101230004432.000|20101230004434.000|TR0|it is more than three hours.  It's usually 
20101230004434.000|20101230004436.000|TR0|four or five hours, depending on the 
20101230004436.000|20101230004439.000|TR0|airline.

20101230004548.000|20101230004551.000|TR0|YELLIN:  If you fly, if you like good 
20101230004551.000|20101230004553.000|TR0|airline fares, and if you like having 
20101230004553.000|20101230004555.000|TR0|competition and choice this story should 
20101230004555.000|20101230004558.000|TR0|interest you.  A bunch of travel website 
20101230004558.000|20101230004600.000|TR0|including Expedia, Kayak and Orbitz, are 
20101230004600.000|20101230004602.000|TR0|banding together to try and stop Google 
20101230004602.000|20101230004605.000|TR0|from get into the online airfare business 
20101230004605.000|20101230004607.000|TR0|and they're asking the government to block 
20101230004607.000|20101230004609.000|TR0|the deal.
20101230004609.000|20101230004612.000|TR0|
20101230004612.000|20101230004614.000|TR0|A little background:  When you book an 
20101230004614.000|20101230004616.000|TR0|airline reservation online, many of the 
20101230004616.000|20101230004618.000|TR0|major travel Web sites use the same 
20101230004618.000|20101230004621.000|TR0|software.  It is from a company called 
20101230004621.000|20101230004623.000|TR0|ITA.  Now Google wants to buy that 
20101230004623.000|20101230004625.000|TR0|software company.  The travel sites say 
20101230004625.000|20101230004628.000|TR0|that's anti-competitive and the Justice 
20101230004628.000|20101230004630.000|TR0|Department is reviewing the case.
20101230004630.000|20101230004632.000|TR0|
20101230004632.000|20101230004635.000|TR0|Here to talk about the legal fight that is

20101230004637.000|20101230004639.000|TR0|that right?

20101230004642.000|20101230004644.000|TR0|ADAM KOVACEVICH, GOOGLE:  Yes.      
20101230004644.000|20101230004646.000|TR0|YELLIN:  And via Skype from Gainesville,

20101230004649.000|20101230004651.000|TR0|for Expedia, and he headed up the Justice

20101230004653.000|20101230004656.000|TR0|George W. Bush administration.

20101230004700.000|20101230004703.000|TR0|
20101230004703.000|20101230004705.000|TR0|Adam, first to you.  Doesn't Google have 
20101230004705.000|20101230004707.000|TR0|enough on its hands? Why get into the 
20101230004707.000|20101230004710.000|TR0|travel business, too?
20101230004710.000|20101230004712.000|TR0|
20101230004712.000|20101230004714.000|TR0|(LAUGHTER)
20101230004714.000|20101230004717.000|TR0|
20101230004717.000|20101230004719.000|TR0|KOVACEVICH:  That is a good question.  
20101230004719.000|20101230004721.000|TR0|Let's imagine that you had some time 
20101230004721.000|20101230004724.000|TR0|coming off.  And you know that might have 
20101230004724.000|20101230004726.000|TR0|$500 to spend. And you want to flight 
20101230004726.000|20101230004728.000|TR0|somewhere sunny.  If you type that query 
20101230004728.000|20101230004731.000|TR0|into Google or any other search engine 
20101230004731.000|20101230004733.000|TR0|today, you're not going to get a very good 
20101230004733.000|20101230004735.000|TR0|answer.  You're going to get what we call 
20101230004735.000|20101230004737.000|TR0|the 10 blue links. What we would like to 
20101230004737.000|20101230004740.000|TR0|do, in acquiring ITA software, is to 
20101230004740.000|20101230004742.000|TR0|provide a better answer for consumers in 
20101230004742.000|20101230004744.000|TR0|the form of airfares, flight times, and 
20101230004744.000|20101230004747.000|TR0|then send them to sites like Expedia, 
20101230004747.000|20101230004749.000|TR0|Travelocity, and other sites where they 
20101230004749.000|20101230004751.000|TR0|can actually buy a ticket.
20101230004751.000|20101230004754.000|TR0|
20101230004754.000|20101230004756.000|TR0|YELLIN:  Tom, you represent Expedia.  So 
20101230004756.000|20101230004758.000|TR0|my question, I can see why this is 
20101230004758.000|20101230004801.000|TR0|competition for your client, but it sounds 
20101230004801.000|20101230004803.000|TR0|like it could mean more choice for 
20101230004803.000|20101230004805.000|TR0|consumers.  Having Google get into this 
20101230004805.000|20101230004808.000|TR0|business couldn't that actually drive 
20101230004808.000|20101230004810.000|TR0|prices down?
20101230004810.000|20101230004812.000|TR0|
20101230004812.000|20101230004815.000|TR0|TOM BARNETT, ATTORNEY FOR EXPEDIA:  Well, 
20101230004815.000|20101230004817.000|TR0|Google getting into the business is fine.  
20101230004817.000|20101230004819.000|TR0|The question is how they get into it.  All 
20101230004819.000|20101230004822.000|TR0|the competition you have today between 
20101230004822.000|20101230004824.000|TR0|Expedia, Orbitz, Kayak, Travelocity and 
20101230004824.000|20101230004826.000|TR0|others, Bing Travel, has been great for 
20101230004826.000|20101230004829.000|TR0|consumers.
20101230004829.000|20101230004831.000|TR0|
20101230004831.000|20101230004833.000|TR0|And while I readily agree with Adam that 
20101230004833.000|20101230004836.000|TR0|more innovation is a good thing and we 
20101230004836.000|20101230004838.000|TR0|want that, competition is what's going to 
20101230004838.000|20101230004840.000|TR0|drive that.  Google can get into the 
20101230004840.000|20101230004843.000|TR0|travel space on its own or by licensing 
20101230004843.000|20101230004845.000|TR0|the ITA software, which everyone else has 
20101230004845.000|20101230004847.000|TR0|done.  The issue that we're focused on and 
20101230004847.000|20101230004850.000|TR0|that we believe the Justice Department is 
20101230004850.000|20101230004852.000|TR0|focused on, is Google purchasing the ITA 
20101230004852.000|20101230004854.000|TR0|software instead of licensing it.  So they 
20101230004854.000|20101230004856.000|TR0|can deny access to that software to all of

20101230005230.000|20101230005233.000|TR0|-- and ITA have flat- out refused to

20101230005235.000|20101230005237.000|TR0|license.  So, I'm not there yet.  But it's

20101230005240.000|20101230005242.000|TR0|
20101230005242.000|20101230005244.000|TR0|Google is the dominant search engine on 
20101230005244.000|20101230005247.000|TR0|the Internet right now. It controls well 
20101230005247.000|20101230005249.000|TR0|over 70 percent of all Internet searches.  
20101230005249.000|20101230005251.000|TR0|Travel search is an area where, because of 
20101230005251.000|20101230005253.000|TR0|access to technology like ITA, and my 
20101230005253.000|20101230005256.000|TR0|client's Best Fare search, companies have 
20101230005256.000|20101230005258.000|TR0|been able to compete and compete 
20101230005258.000|20101230005300.000|TR0|effectively with Google.  If Google is 
20101230005300.000|20101230005303.000|TR0|able to get this, if you will, crown jewel 
20101230005303.000|20101230005305.000|TR0|technology and deny others access, or 
20101230005305.000|20101230005307.000|TR0|undermine their access to it, you combine 
20101230005307.000|20101230005310.000|TR0|that with their overall search dominance, 
20101230005310.000|20101230005312.000|TR0|and you now pose a risk that Google comes 
20101230005312.000|20101230005314.000|TR0|to dominant travel search as well, which 
20101230005314.000|20101230005317.000|TR0|means they can inflict consumer harm if 
20101230005317.000|20101230005319.000|TR0|that should come to pass.
20101230005319.000|20101230005321.000|TR0|
20101230005321.000|20101230005324.000|TR0|KOVACEVICH:  I think that's a really 
20101230005324.000|20101230005326.000|TR0|important point to make. The competition 
20101230005326.000|20101230005328.000|TR0|laws were designed to make sure that 
20101230005328.000|20101230005331.000|TR0|consumers have more choices.  That's what 
20101230005331.000|20101230005333.000|TR0|we think we're providing with this 
20101230005333.000|20101230005335.000|TR0|acquisition of ITA software.  And frankly, 
20101230005335.000|20101230005338.000|TR0|with other acquisitions that we have done, 
20101230005338.000|20101230005340.000|TR0|we have a really good track record of 
20101230005340.000|20101230005342.000|TR0|acquiring companies like YouTube, and 
20101230005342.000|20101230005345.000|TR0|other companies, and then improving those 
20101230005345.000|20101230005347.000|TR0|technologies and making them better.  In 
20101230005347.000|20101230005349.000|TR0|some cases available at lower cost for 
20101230005349.000|20101230005352.000|TR0|consumers, for businesses, and that that's 
20101230005352.000|20101230005354.000|TR0|what we hope to do here.
20101230005354.000|20101230005356.000|TR0|
20101230005356.000|20101230005359.000|TR0|YELLIN:  Tom, will you put on your larger

20101230005403.000|20101230005406.000|TR0|Google gets into the place they think they

20101230005415.000|20101230005417.000|TR0|the broad sweep that Google is simply 
20101230005417.000|20101230005419.000|TR0|growing too big?
20101230005419.000|20101230005422.000|TR0|
20101230005422.000|20101230005424.000|TR0|BARNETT:  Well, I am concerned if there's 
20101230005424.000|20101230005426.000|TR0|only one company innovating.  Google has 
20101230005426.000|20101230005429.000|TR0|created many great products and I applaud 
20101230005429.000|20101230005431.000|TR0|them for it.  And if they're able to 
20101230005431.000|20101230005433.000|TR0|develop new ways to do travel search, and 
20101230005433.000|20101230005436.000|TR0|new ways to present it to consumers that 
20101230005436.000|20101230005438.000|TR0|are better, that's great. It will make us 
20101230005438.000|20101230005440.000|TR0|better as well, provided we and other 
20101230005440.000|20101230005443.000|TR0|travel sites are not deprived to access to 
20101230005443.000|20101230005445.000|TR0|key technology, and that we have a fair 
20101230005445.000|20101230005447.000|TR0|access to consumers.

20101230005452.000|20101230005454.000|TR0|know, most Internet searches today start

20101230005457.000|20101230005459.000|TR0|steer folks through various mechanisms

20101230005501.000|20101230005504.000|TR0|companies like Expedia, even though we may

20101230005653.000|20101230005655.000|TR0|PETE DOMINICK, OFFBEAT REPORTER:  That's 
20101230005655.000|20101230005657.000|TR0|right, Jessica.
20101230005657.000|20101230005700.000|TR0|
